title: League should do what Overwatch did
body: A new character was released and isn't pickable in ranked. Riot should do this with new/reworked champs

Also there are people who used him in the PBE so they have a lot of experience with him. You do not even need that many games in order to know what a champion does. You play one or two games and you have a general idea of what the champion does and how their abilities behave. It doesn't matter if a champion is new or just got reworked. You don't want that champion in ranked? ban him!

The difference is that some people may not have played, lets say alistar, but they have almost certainly played _against_ alistar or _with_ an alistar before and at least know what he does. Meanwhile they haven't played galio, or played against him, or played with him on their team and consequently have much less knowledge of the champion.

Don't they have that new useless champion grade system Riot implemented? Ya maybe Riot can actually put it to good use and make sure people actually get to level 3-5 on the champion to play it in rank.

We've covered this before, having a champion mastery restriction would effectively prevent you from trading with allies, since you wouldn't be able to lock in the champion unless you both had them at the minimum level.
Require Mastery 2 to play a champion in ranked. Boom. Problem solved.
Dumb for two reasons. You would need 16 champs with mastery two just to play ranked. Second reason is mastery 2 is no different than being brand new to a champ

yeah there's already a thread discussing this exact subject literally sitting on the front page with 150 upvotes made 24 hours ago, why did think there's a need to make a new one?
"Front page" is relative - there are 4 front pages, one for each of the four ways to sort the boards.
They are both in gameplay.

But that doesn't answer the question "which frontpage", since that leaves 8 possible front pages.

* Boards - New
* Boards - Recent
* Boards - Hot
* Boards - Best
* Gameplay - New
* Gameplay - Recent
* Gameplay - Hot
* Gameplay - Best
The "front page" is the boards page that loads up when you first go to the boards. Don't play dumb.

Understand how the boards work before you accuse me of playing dumb.

Each section remembers the way you sorted it the last time you were there, so when you refresh the page or pull up the boards on another device it's sorted that way. As I recall it defaults to Best the first time you load up, but since those topics rarely change people swap to one of the other 3 depending on their viewing habits. From that point on, that becomes their default. 

All 8 options I listed were valid front pages that people could have selected at some point in the past and be using. It's ignorant to assume others are using the same sorting as you.
*what Smite did.
Don't play Smite so I didn't know
Right. I just had a Galio jungle last game in plat rank, he went 2/8 in 15 minutes
That would require Riot to actually give a shit about their players experience in ranked play.

Conceptually I rather like this idea, and would be curious to see any arguments for/against it that Riot might have debated. Because I'm CERTAIN they have considered this possibility, and that probably means there are strong arguments against it that I'm not thinking of right now, or it's still a topic in discussion.

There's also the argument that you have to purchase individual characters in *League* but get them all for free in *Overwatch*, which means denying someone a character in their preferred game mode is a bit more of a blow to the player. That alone is a rather compelling argument to keep them usable, and definitely complicates the discussion.

Oh, I totally get that. I'm just trying to think like a developer here and weight the pros and cons. A big pro is keeping characters players are new to out of ranked...but a big con is not letting players who prefer ranked play their new modes with their new purchases.

It's even more complicated by the fact that there's nothing stopping me from buying a champion I've never played who ISN'T new and taking THAT champion into ranked, so I feel that unless we limit the "new champion purchase" ranked play as well as the "new champion released" ranked play we're being hippocritical.

I also understand your point and it would solve some problem but cause other one . Why they making OP champ at the release , its because they want them to buy the champion and use it . It also put a idea in the mind of the player that with this you will be succesfull and extremely strong ( in some point yes but a op kit doesnt cover your own mistake in game ) and the last think who come in my mind is that there are alot of variety in the champ select and overwatch dont have that so it make the balancing way harder in some point . They need to make the hero not too op , not too weak , fun to play with and against , not conflicting with the playground , bug , interaction , etc .
The game of overwatch is at a young state where they try to slowly make a enjoyable place and entertaining . League already have these aspect and no one cant conflict against the entertainement of your customer or they become angry as fck and break thing or threat from stopping the game . They want new champions to be usable, but they want ALL champions to be somewhat usable. It's just that recently a lot of champions have erred on the stronger side, but there have been a number of releases that were underpowered at first as well.

They have. The reason, I believe, they don't do it is because any champion has the potential to be new to the individual player. If I unlock yasuo and decide I'm going to first time him in rank how's that any different from when a new champion releases? I guess you could make it so that new champions both bought and released are locked for a week in ranked but that just feels awful to buy something and then not be able to use it hence why they probably don't do it.
